newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: TENNIS-ROMANIA STAYS IN RACE FOR HOPMAN CUP FINAL.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-ROMANIA STAYS IN RACE FOR HOPMAN CUP FINAL.

text.p: Newcomers Romania kept alive their chances of reaching the final of the Hopman Cup mixed teams tennis tournament with a 3-0 victory over Germany on Thursday.

Romania took an unassailable 2-0 lead in the Group B match after Adrian Voinea and Irina Spirlea won their singles rubbers. They then made it a clean sweep with a straight sets victory in the doubles.
Voinea survived two match points against Bernd Karbacher before clinching the tie, 2-6 7-6 (7-4) 6-2.
World number 11 Spirlea scored a comfortable 6-1 6-3 win against Petra Begerow, a late replacement for the sick Steffi Graf.
Romania lost their opening match to second seeds Switzerland, but can still qualify for Saturday's final if they upset unbeaten South Africa on Friday and Germany beat Switzerland.
Switzerland's chances of qualifying, however, are unlikely with Marc Rosset a doubtful starter due to a back injury.
In a Group A double-header later on Thursday, the United States, Australia and Croatia all have a chance of booking a finals berth.
The undefeated U.S. team of Justin Gimelstob and Chanda Rubin take on Australians Mark Philippoussis and Nicole Bradtke and top seeds Croatia play France.
